title: Rab and His Friends and Other Papers
author: Brown, John
snippet: Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither rain upon you.

title: Rab and His Friends and Other Papers
author: Brown, John
snippet: Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither rain upon you.

title: From Occident to Orient.
author: Smith, William Alexander.
snippet: Little Hermon with Nain and Endor a few miles to the southwest, the mount of Gilboa to the south, eastward the continuation of Esdraelon and the Jordan, westward the whole stretch of Esdraelon — the old valley of Jezreel, or Plain of Megiddo — with the bold Carmel  promontory, and to the northward the Nazareth hills with the town nestling in among them at a distance of about six miles.

title: From Occident to Orient.
author: Smith, William Alexander.
snippet: There at our feet is the beautiful plain of Esdraelon, stretching from the mounts of Gilboa on the east to Carmel on the west, a distance of twenty-four miles.

title: Horae subsecivae.
author: Brown, John
snippet: Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither rain upon you.

title: Horae subsecivae.
author: Brown, John
snippet: How your heart now fills, as well as your eyes ! How you realize the idea ! What a sacred significance it gives to the place, and receives from it ! What thoughts it awakens! Saul and his miserable story, David and his lamentation, the mountains of Gilboa,  the streets of Askelon.
